facts: The first personal computer, the Altair 8800, was released in 1975 and cost $397.
The first mobile phone call was made in 1973 by Martin Cooper using a Motorola DynaTAC.
Transistors revolutionized electronics by replacing bulky vacuum tubes in the 1950s.

dialog.greeting: Greetings! 2TailedFox offers a bit of everything - Commodore, Atari, IBM compatibles, and more!

facts: Commodore's Amiga was released in 1985 and was ahead of its time with multitasking capabilities.
Atari's 2600 console, released in 1977, helped popularize home video gaming.
IBM's PC, introduced in 1981, set the standard for personal computing with its open architecture.
